intro: Armeriastrum scirpinum, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in the spring and early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs, and it has a compact, mat-like growth habit. Armeriastrum scirpinum is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats.
